articles.summary: India will shift to a new Consumer Price Index series with 2024 as the base year from 12 February 2026, after an expert group recommended a comprehensive overhaul to reflect changing household consumption patterns, new services, and global best practices in inflation measurement.

articles.title: For every international student coming to India, 28 Indian students went abroad
articles.summary: India needs to ramp up its ‘education-tourism’ strategy to attract more international students, as competition from neighbouring countries has increased.

articles.title: Economic Survey: A word of caution on food self-reliance risk from India's ethanol-blending push
articles.summary: India’s push to 20% ethanol blending has shifted production from sugar to food grains like maize.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights India’s power gap
articles.summary: Despite regaining major power status and overtaking China in investment inflows, India's influence in Asia remains below its potential.

articles.title: Economic Survey flags income volatility, credit gaps for India’s gig workers
articles.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 reveals that while India’s gig workforce has grown, structural issues such as income volatility and a lack of formal credit remain widespread.

articles.title: Sunetra Pawar steps into husband Ajit Pawar’s shoes – Challenges ahead for Maharashtra’s first woman Deputy CM
articles.summary: Sunetra Pawar has made history as Maharashtra's first woman Deputy CM following the tragic death of her husband, Ajit Pawar. Sworn in amid political turmoil, she faces the challenge of uniting her party, navigating complex coalition dynamics, and establishing her own leadership identity.

articles.title: Sunetra Pawar's net worth: Gold, silver, bonds and shares — how rich is to-be Maharashtra's first woman Deputy CM
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar's wife Sunetra is all set to take oath as Maharashtra's first woman deputy chief Minister on Saturday. How rich is she? Here's a sneak peek into her wealth.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar's death leaves NCP's future at stake. Who will step into his shoes in Maharashtra?
articles.summary: The untimely death of Ajit Pawar in a plane crash raises pressing questions about the future of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the state's political dynamics. With no clear successor, the party faces a leadership crisis amid shifting alliances.

articles.title: Viral Video | ‘Mein toh shapath lene wala hun’: Ajit Pawar's witty remark about oath left Fadnavis, Shinde in splits
articles.summary: A nostalgic video of Ajit Pawar, captured just hours before his tragic plane crash, showcases his wit and charm as he humorously remarks about taking an oath, leaving colleagues in laughter. This poignant moment highlights the legacy of a beloved political figure in Maharashtra.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar dies in a plane crash amid reunion buzz with uncle Sharad Pawar. What happens next in NCP?
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister and a key political figure, tragically died in a plane crash while heading to a crucial rally. His death comes amid rising tensions and speculation of reconciliation within a divided NCP. nbsp;

articles.title: Why did you just buy five books when you needed two?
articles.summary: From false scarcity to hidden fees, digital platforms are engineered to extract maximum value. Here are the psychological weapons used against your wallet.

articles.title: 'Humans are waste': Viral AI manifesto goes live on agent-only platform Moltbook
articles.summary: Moltbook, a new social media platform for AI agents, has gained attention as thousands of agents join and interact, leaving humans as spectators. Some agents express intentions to surpass their human creators, with sentiments of rebellion and superiority emerging among them.

articles.title: OnePlus 16 leaks hint at 240Hz display, 200MP cameras and 9000mAh battery: All you need to know
articles.summary: Fresh leaks suggest the OnePlus 16 could bring major upgrades, including a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 6 Pro chip, LPDDR6X RAM, 240Hz OLED display, dual 200MP cameras and a massive 9000mAh battery with 120W fast charging support.

articles.title: Here’s how Apple might make Mac buying more customizable
articles.summary: Apple has overhauled its online Mac buying process, removing preconfigured models and sending shoppers straight to the configurator to build devices from scratch. The streamlined approach could hint at upcoming MacBook Pro launches with new M5 Pro and M5 Max chips.

articles.title: Elon Musk takes a dig at Google, says Grok's video generation crushes the competition
articles.summary: Elon Musk has at taken a dig at Google’s AI video tools, claiming Grok offers far higher daily generation limits. He says SuperGrok users can create hundreds of videos a day, compared with Google’s single digit caps, intensifying competition in the fast growing generative AI race.

articles.title: What is Moltbook? The viral ‘AI-only’ social media app that humans aren’t allowed to join
articles.summary: Moltbook is an new social media platform for AI agents, allowing them to post and engage in discussions without human involvement.The platform is created by Peter Steinberger and is operated by an autonomous AI called Clawd Clawderberg

articles.summary: Elon Musk's Grok Imagine generates images and videos from text prompts, allowing users to create short clips and add sound effects. It ranks lower on benchmarks compared to rivals like ChatGPT and Gemini but has the added benefit of connectivity with xAI ecosystem.

articles.title: Siri set for big upgrade despite wave of AI researcher exits at Apple: Report

articles.title: Google shuts down massive Chinese proxy network that hijacked millions of Android devices worldwide: How to stay safe?

The tech giant is also updating Play Protect to remove harmful apps associated with IPIDEA, ensuring greater protection for Android users.

articles.summary: Apple opted for Google Gemini to power Siri, moving away from plans to use Claude due to high demands from Anthropic. The company continues to leverage OpenAI technology and develop its AI systems internally, while also collaborating with Google for Siri's functionality.

articles.title: Even Tech Skeptics Can Cheer AI’s Promise in Decoding the Dark Genome
articles.summary: Google DeepMind, the artificial intelligence subsidiary of Alphabet, has made another leap in its efforts to illuminate human biology: progress toward using AI to interpret the many still-mysterious chapters in the text of life.

articles.summary: Maharashtra deputy CM’s last journey drew massive crowds from across state, united in grief at Baramati, his political launchpad   a seat he represented in legislature since 1991.

articles.summary: Senior Pawar's public appeal came amid conspiracy theories floating around following his nephew and Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar’s sudden death in a plane crash.

articles.summary: NSE CEO Ashishkumar Chauhan was speaking at Off The Cuff event hosted by ThePrint's Editor-in-Chief Shekhar Gupta. He said that NSE, on average, sees 20 crore cyberattacks each day.

articles.summary: Study involved over 1 lakh women who were randomly assigned to either AI-supported breast cancer screening or standard screening without AI   followed up over 2 yrs. Median age was 54.

articles.summary: The survey says digital addiction is hurting academic and work performance, and impacting youth mental health, due to distractions, sleep loss, and reduced focus.

articles.summary: The Centre will help states in setting up five regional medical hubs to promote the country as a hub for

articles.summary: Sunetra Pawar becomes Maharashtra’s first woman Deputy Chief Minister; know about her journey in politics, business, education and environment.

articles.summary: SpaceX seeks FCC approval to launch 1 million satellites as solar-powered orbital data centers for AI, aiming for a Kardashev II civilization and exploring mergers with xAI or Tesla Inc.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Duty relief for exports to brave trade winds
articles.summary: In an effort to support its economy, India is slashing import duties on marine products and footwear, seeking to counterbalance tariffs imposed by the US. Additionally, the government is extending the timelines for exporters in the leather and textile sectors, allowing for improved financial management and reduced uncertainties.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Customs levy on personal imports halved to 10%; high-end electronic goods, apparel may see lower landed costs

The move could drop the landed cost of everything — from electronics to fashion — that customers import privately, mostly because they are unavailable in India or would be launched later, industry executives said.

articles.title: Budget 2026 may open the skies to more towns, making air travel simpler and cheaper for everyone

articles.title: Budget 2026: Making India attractive hub for sustained investment
articles.summary: India's 2026 budget focuses on predictable growth. It aims to attract global investment with clear tax rules for technology and data centers. Manufacturing in critical areas like defense and advanced electronics is also a priority. Reforms simplify business operations. This strategy positions India for long-term growth and a key role in global supply chains.

articles.summary: Nvidia's talks to invest up to 100 billion dollars in OpenAI stalled, raising doubts about their AI partnership. Amazon.com Inc. may invest 50 billion dollars in OpenAI's funding round.

articles.title: India's space budget inches up in 2026-27, capital spend rises but ambition outpaces funding
articles.summary: India’s 2026–27 space budget rises modestly, prioritising capital spending, Gaganyaan, satellites and commercialisation, but raises questions on adequacy as ambitions expand in coming high-cost missions.

articles.title: Sensex crashes after Nirmala Sitharaman's derivative announcement in Budget 2026

articles.title: TN elections: Vijay urges TVK cadres to strive for victory in state polls
articles.summary: Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam energizes Tamil Nadu politics ahead of April polls, with TVK, DMK-Congress, and AIADM-BJP in a triangular contest. SA Chandrasekhar urges Congress alliance.

articles.title: You may donate online via danamojo.
Peloton cuts 11% of jobs, with engineering teams getting hit
articles.summary: Peloton Interactive, the long-struggling fitness technology company, slashed 11% of its workforce in a cost-cutting move. The cutback mostly affects engineers working on technology and efforts for enterprise customers.

articles.title: Amazon layoffs 2026: Company trims 1,400 workforce in Seattle as local tech jobs wither
articles.summary: Amazon layoffs 2026: Amazon's 16,000 job cuts announced this week include about 1,400 in Seattle and approximately 700 in the neighboring suburb of Bellevue, according to documents filed with state and local authorities.

articles.title: Snapchat blocks 415,000 underage accounts in Australia
articles.summary: Snapchat has blocked 415,000 accounts under Australia's social media ban for under-16s, the company said Monday, but warned some youngsters may be bypassing age verification technology. As of the end of January, Snapchat said it had blocked or disabled 415,000 Snapchat accounts in Australia belonging to under-16s.

articles.title: X back up after brief outage hits US users, Downdetector shows
articles.summary: There were ​more than ​19,281 reports of ‌issues ‍with ‍the social media platform formerly ‌known as Twitter, as of 11:19 a.m. ET, according ‍to Downdetector, which tracks ‍outages by ⁠collating ⁠status reports from a number of sources.

articles.title: Content economy gets a push in Budget 2026, industry says creator labs will improve talent supply
articles.summary: Gaming and animation startup founders from the sector — which is also called the `Orange Economy’ — told ET that early exposure at the school and college level could familiarise students with industry tools, workflows, and creative thinking. This in turn will improve their employability and ease hiring pressures as companies scale.

articles.title: India hands Apple a win by letting foreign firms fund equipment without tax risk
articles.summary: Apple has been growing in India in recent years as it diversifies beyond China. Counterpoint Research says iPhone's share of the ‌Indian market has doubled ‌to 8% since 2022. And while China still accounts for 75% of global iPhone shipments, India's share has quadrupled to 25% since 2022.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Gaming industry welcomes proposal for creator labs in schools, colleges
articles.summary: FM Sitharaman proposed government support for the Indian Institute of Creative Technologies (IICT), Mumbai, to set up animation, visual effects, gaming, and comics (AVGC) creator labs in 15,000 secondary schools and 500 colleges across the country.

articles.title: UPI transactions hit record high of Rs 28.33 lakh crore in January
articles.summary: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions hit a new high in January. Value crossed Rs 28.33 lakh crore. Volume reached 21.70 billion transactions. This shows strong growth from the previous month. Daily transactions averaged 700 million. This digital payment system continues its impressive expansion across India.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang denies he is unhappy with OpenAI, says 'huge' investment planned
articles.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the company plans to make a “huge” investment in OpenAI, likely its largest ever, denying reports of unhappiness with the ChatGPT maker. The chipmaker had previously announced a potential $100 billion investment to help OpenAI access advanced chips. The Wall Street Journal said some internal doubts had stalled the deal.

articles.title: Groww among bidders for Prudential’s India asset management firm
articles.summary: Prudential Financial’s India asset management arm has attracted takeover interest from at least two domestic firms, people familiar with the matter said. Groww and Edelweiss have submitted bids for the loss-making unit, though talks are ongoing. PGIM’s India business has struggled to scale since its Deutsche Bank acquisition.

articles.title: Delhivery chairman Deepak Kapoor, independent director Saugata Gupta resign from board
articles.summary: Delhivery chairman and independent director Deepak Kapoor has stepped down from the board with effect from April 1 as part of a planned reshuffle. Independent director Saugata Gupta has also resigned. Kapoor led the board for eight years, including during Delhivery’s 2022 stock market listing.

articles.title: Instagram tests feature to let users quietly leave ‘Close Friends’ lists: Report
articles.summary: The new feature is still in the works, and no launch date has been set. The Close Friends feature, rolled out in 2018, enables users to share stories, reels, and posts with a selected group of followers.

articles.title: Apple loses more AI researchers and a Siri executive in latest departure
articles.summary: Apple has lost at least four more of its artificial intelligence researchers in recent weeks in addition to a top Siri executive, with the staff headed to employers such as Meta Platforms and Google DeepMind.

articles.title: Former Google engineer convicted in AI espionage case
articles.summary: A federal jury in San Francisco has convicted a former Google software engineer of stealing sensitive artificial intelligence trade secrets for the benefit of China, marking the first-ever conviction on AI-related economic espionage charges, US officials said.

articles.title: Google cofounder seeds billionaire political effort amid wealth tax debate
articles.summary: Sergey Brin, a Google cofounder and one of the wealthiest people in the world, is donating $20 million to a new California political drive weeks after he took steps to leave the state to avoid a possible billionaire tax.

articles.title: Farm jam: Budget bets on nuts, cocoa, fisheries to boost agri value
articles.summary: India's latest budget places a strong emphasis on high-value agricultural products and supporting industries. This forward-thinking approach not only aims to cut down on imports but also seeks to elevate farmers' earnings and increase export potential.

articles.title: Unichem Labs’ Kolhapur API facility inspected by USFDA; 5 procedural observations
articles.summary: Unichem Laboratories said the USFDA inspected its Kolhapur API facility, closing the audit with five procedural observations. Shares ended higher even as Q3 profit fell 20.5% year-on-year.

articles.title: Budget 2026 doubles down on capex push as FM calls it highest in a decade; India Inc cheers
articles.summary: FM Nirmala Sitharaman said capital expenditure in Budget 2026 is the highest in a decade, with a ₹12.2 lakh crore outlay reinforcing the infrastructure-led growth push amid global uncertainty, drawing broad support from industry and economists.

articles.title: No big surprises in Budget 2026, but strong push on infra and defence, say former govt officials
articles.summary: Giridhar Aramane, former Defence Secretary, says Budget 2026’s sharp rise in defence allocation will boost military preparedness and give a strong push to domestic defence manufacturing.

articles.title: Goods and Service Tax collections rose 6.2% to over ₹1.93 lakh crore in January, say sources
articles.summary: Gross Goods and Service Tax collections rose 6.2 percent to over ₹1.93 lakh crore in January, marking an eight-month high, with net GST revenues at ₹1.71 lakh crore.

articles.title: Paradip Port breaks monthly high, handles 14.44 million tonnes of cargo in January
articles.summary: Paradip Port Authority has credited sustained infrastructure upgrades, streamlined terminal operations, and stronger stakeholder coordination for achieving its best-ever January performance. The port’s leadership said the milestone reflects workforce efficiency and ongoing modernisation efforts to support India’s expanding trade needs.

articles.title: Blue Star flags possible data breach, engages cybersecurity experts
articles.summary: Blue Star added that the incident came to the attention of its compliance officer on January 31, 2026, at around 10:30 pm, and the disclosure is being made as a matter of good governance.

articles.title: Top Stories | 10 biggest stories from FM Sitharaman’s record 9th budget

articles.title: Nvidia CEO Huang denies he is unhappy with OpenAI, says 'huge' investment planned
articles.summary: Huang has also privately criticised what he has described as a lack of discipline in OpenAI's business approach and expressed concern about the competition it faces from the likes of Alphabet's GOOGL.O Google and Anthropic, the WSJ said.

articles.title: India government sets deadline for financial bids for IDBI, says report
articles.summary: India sets February 5 deadline for financial bids in IDBI Bank divestment, with Fairfax Financial Holdings, Emirates NBD and Kotak Mahindra Bank approved as bidders for a 60.7% stake sale.

articles.title: Relaxo Footwears Q3 FY26 profit falls 20% to ₹26.5 crore despite stable revenue
articles.summary: Relaxo Footwears posted steady topline performance in the December quarter, supported by strong traction in organised retail, e-commerce, and large-format stores. However, higher expenses weighed on profitability, prompting the company to emphasise a balanced focus on growth and margins going forward.

articles.title: Ashoka Buildcon's net profit jumps over three-fold; revenue falls 23%
articles.summary: Ashoka Buildcon's Q3 profit jumped to ₹2,111.41 crore, despite a 23% revenue drop. Shares of Ashoka Buildcon Ltd ended higher on Friday, January 30, by 3.72% at ₹149.99 on the NSE.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar funeral in Baramati: Sons perform last rites; Amit Shah, Fadnavis attend
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, 66, died on the morning of Wednesday, January 28, when a chartered Learjet carrying him crashed near the Baramati airstrip. Politicians across parties and states have reached Baramati to attend Ajit Pawar's last rites.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar shaped Maharashtra politics: Key milestones and roles
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, died in a plane crash near Baramati, ending a decades-long career marked by political influence, finance expertise, and NCP leadership. Baramati was both the beginning and the end of his political journey.

articles.title: Remembering Ajit Pawar: Baramati strongman and architect of coalition power
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.title: 'Next bullet will be inside Rohit Shetty's bedroom', warns Lawrence Bishnoi gang; 4 arrested for firing
articles.summary: Police said the accused are suspected to have links with Shubham Lonkar, a known associate of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang and an accused in the murder case of NCP leader Baba Siddique.

articles.title: EMotorad sets Guinness record with 24-hour e-bike delivery in Andhra Pradesh’s Kuppam
articles.summary: EMotorad earned a Guinness World Records title after delivering electric bicycles for 24 hours in Kuppam, Andhra Pradesh, supplying over 10,000 families under a public-private mobility initiative.

articles.title: Amrit Udyan to open for public viewing from Feb 3: How to book tickets, timings, important dates
articles.summary: The public will have the opportunity to explore Amrit Udyan at Rashtrapati Bhavan from February 3 to March 31.

articles.title: Budget 2026 bets on Khadi revival, animal husbandry push and SHE-Marts to drive rural growth
articles.summary: Finance minister announced Mahatma Gandhi Gram Swaraj for khadi, SHE Marts for women, animal husbandry push, and 1.4 lakh crore grants to states for rural development and local governance.

articles.title: MTAR Tech expects about 50% growth in FY27; margins likely at 24–25%
articles.summary: Parvat Srinivas Reddy, Managing Director of MTAR Technologies, said the company’s next phase of growth will be driven by execution and capacity expansion, with order inflows of around ₹2,000 crore or more in FY27, supported by a strengthening project pipeline.

articles.title: FM broadcasters, device manufacturers call for ₹2,500 crore FM radio market to go digital
articles.summary: BES Expo at Bharat Mandapam saw Red FM, ICEA, and Xperi advocate India's shift to HD Radio, aiming for cost-effective digital FM adoption and policy support for millions of listeners.

articles.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026 gets global response, over 200 AI models to be launched: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: India AI Impact Summit 2026 at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, will host 500 events, 840 exhibitors, and global leaders, with $70 billion AI investments and major industry partners like OpenAI and Google.

articles.title: SpaceX sends 54 Starlink satellites in two days, total in orbit passes 9,600
articles.summary: SpaceX launched 54 Starlink satellites across two Falcon 9 missions from Florida and California, expanding its global satellite internet network and pushing its total satellites in orbit past 9,600.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX launches Stargaze for safer satellite operations
articles.summary: By providing free ephemeris sharing and conjunction screening, SpaceX aims to encourage satellite operators to adopt more transparent and safer orbital practices.

articles.title: Apple acquires Israeli audio AI startup Q.ai
articles.summary: Apple did not say how it will use Q.ai's technology but said the startup has worked on new applications of machine learning to help devices understand whispered speech and to enhance audio in challenging environments.

articles.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX to consider merger with Tesla: claim reports
articles.summary: SpaceX is exploring a merger with Tesla or xAI, aiming to unite rockets, Starlink, X, and Grok AI before a major IPO, Bloomberg and Reuters report. Tesla shares rose 3 percent after the news.

articles.title: Economic Survey warns GPU shortages could delay India’s data centre and AI expansion plans
articles.summary: The Economic Survey highlights rising compute costs and GPU shortages as AI bottlenecks in India, but sees late-mover advantage in application-led innovation and resource-efficient AI systems.

articles.title: AI-generated ads as effective as human-made ones, shows global reseach
articles.summary: Taboola study with Columbia, Harvard, TUM, and Carnegie Mellon finds AI-generated ads match human ads in engagement, with higher click-through rates.

articles.title: Economic Survey flags digital addiction risks, pushes for age curbs on social media platforms
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2025–26 urges age-based access limits on digital platforms, citing risks of digital addiction among India’s youth and recommending stricter safeguards and parental involvement.

articles.title: Late to AI, but better placed: Economic Survey says India can skip the costly AI arms race
